content.raw: We can probably remove `Camera`, `RenderTexture`, `PixelBox` and `Overlay`. And maybe add `Entity`?
content.html: We can probably remove Camera, RenderTexture, PixelBox and Overlay. And maybe add Entity?

content.raw: Can we update this header guard? I'm not sure how it should end up in this case though... If we follow the [style guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#The__define_Guard) and use path, do we have `_GAZEBO_RENDERING_SELECTION_BUFFER_SELECTIONBUFFER_HH`?
content.html: Can we update this header guard? I'm not sure how it should end up in this case though... If we follow the style guide and use path, do we have _GAZEBO_RENDERING_SELECTION_BUFFER_SELECTIONBUFFER_HH?

like this?

diff -r 1bee20817881 gazebo/rendering/selection_buffer/SelectionBuffer.cc
--- a/gazebo/rendering/selection_buffer/SelectionBuffer.cc  Tue Dec 29 11:41:36 2015 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/rendering/selection_buffer/SelectionBuffer.cc  Wed Dec 30 10:32:45 2015 -0800
@@ -15,6 +15,7 @@
  *
 */

+#include <memory>
 #include "gazebo/common/Console.hh"
 #include "gazebo/rendering/ogre_gazebo.h"
 #include "gazebo/rendering/RenderTypes.hh"
@@ -38,10 +39,10 @@

       /// \brief A render target listener that sets up the material switcher
       /// to run on every update of this render target.
-      SelectionRenderListener *selectionTargetListener;
+      std::unique_ptr<SelectionRenderListener> selectionTargetListener;

       /// \brief Ogre scene manager
-      Ogre::SceneManager *sceneMgr;
+      std::unique_ptr<Ogre::SceneManager> sceneMgr;

       /// \brief Pointer to the camera that will be used to render to texture
       Ogre::Camera *camera;
@@ -80,9 +81,9 @@
   this->dataPtr->pixelBox = 0;

   this->dataPtr->camera = this->dataPtr->sceneMgr->getCamera(_cameraName);
-  this->dataPtr->materialSwitchListener = new MaterialSwitcher();
-  this->dataPtr->selectionTargetListener = new SelectionRenderListener(
-      this->dataPtr->materialSwitchListener);
+  this->dataPtr->materialSwitchListener.reset(new MaterialSwitcher());
+  this->dataPtr->selectionTargetListener.reset(new SelectionRenderListener(
+      this->dataPtr->materialSwitchListener));
   this->CreateRTTBuffer();
   this->CreateRTTOverlays();
 }
@@ -91,8 +92,6 @@
 SelectionBuffer::~SelectionBuffer()
 {
   this->DeleteRTTBuffer();
-  delete this->dataPtr->selectionTargetListener;
-  delete this->dataPtr->materialSwitchListener;
 }

 /////////////////////////////////////////////////

content.raw: We could make these (`materialSwitchListener` and `selectionTargetListener`) `unique_ptr`'s, and then the cleanup will be taken care of automatically.
content.html: We could make these (materialSwitchListener and selectionTargetListener) unique_ptr's, and then the cleanup will be taken care of automatically.

content.raw: you are right, I've use [this approach](http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?PimplIdiom). All we can do to reduce the number of headers should turn into a better compilation performance.
content.html: you are right, I've use this approach. All we can do to reduce the number of headers should turn into a better compilation performance.

content.html: made one minor change - added some doxygen comments to the private class variables in 1bee208

content.raw: Looks good. Just one question, we've been putting the private class in it's own header file but here it is in the src file. It should not make any difference but just wondering if we want to keep the style consistent?
